skill.name: Receipt Scanning Tools Skill
skill.description: This skill helps you work with the receipt scanning tools in the nonprofit_finance_db project. It includes manual entry tools, automated OCR scanning, and database integration for tracking receipts and expenses.

skill.author: EGAdams

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill. Contains no executable code. Provides reference material for receipt scanning workflow and database schema documentation.

content.value_statement: Organizations need a systematic way to record and categorize expense receipts. This skill provides documented workflows for manual receipt entry, automated OCR scanning, and database integration for accurate financial tracking.
actual_capabilities: Manual receipt entry with categorized merchant selection
Database schema documentation for expenses and merchants
OCR integration patterns using Gemini API
Hierarchical category management with recursive queries
Transaction viewing and database inspection commands
limitations: This is documentation-only - no direct code execution
Requires virtual environment activation before running tools
OCR features require separate Gemini API key configuration

use_cases.title: Track Ministry Expenses
use_cases.description: Record and categorize church or ministry expenses including gifts, offerings, and supplies with organized merchant menus.

use_cases.title: Manage Receipt Records
use_cases.description: Maintain accurate expense records in a MySQL database with proper category hierarchies and merchant tracking.

use_cases.title: Build Receipt Tools
use_cases.description: Use documented patterns to extend receipt scanning functionality with Python and Rich CLI library.

output_examples.input: How do I record a new expense in the database?
output: 2. Run the manual entry tool: python3 receipt_scanning_tools/manual_entry.py
3. Select merchant from categorized menu (Gifts, Ministers, Presents, Food & Supplies)
5. Select expense category from hierarchical list
6. Review summary and confirm to save
The expense will be inserted into the expenses table with proper foreign keys.

best_practices: Always activate virtual environment before running Python receipt tools
Use context managers for database connections to ensure proper cleanup
Validate user input for dates and amounts before database insertion
anti_patterns: Skipping virtual environment activation leads to ModuleNotFoundError
Assuming column names exist without checking schema first
Not using parameterized queries when inserting user data

faq.question: Which Python version is required?
faq.answer: Python 3.x with mysql-connector-python and Rich library for CLI output.

faq.question: What database does this skill use?
faq.answer: MySQL with a nonprofit_finance database. Connection settings stored in .env file.

faq.question: How do I integrate OCR scanning?
faq.answer: Configure GEMINI_API_KEY in your environment. Use the documented patterns in app/services/receipt_engine.py.

faq.question: Is my financial data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only documents patterns. Database credentials should be stored securely in .env file.

faq.question: Why do I get module import errors?
faq.answer: Most import errors come from forgetting to activate the virtual environment first.

faq.question: How is this different from other receipt tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on a nonprofit finance use case with pre-organized merchant categories for ministry giving.
